decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo, which involves stacking the top of the library with key cards like Thassa's Oracle and winning the game in one turn. It uses cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly and cards like Doomsday to manipulate the graveyard and draw the necessary pieces. The deck also includes disruption like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The key strategy is to carefully plan out the Doomsday pile to ensure a successful win condition.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly and efficiently get out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield using Show and Tell. This is done by manipulating the deck with cards like Intuition and Stock Up, while also having protection with cards like Force of Will and Veil of Summer. The deck aims to overwhelm and surprise opponents with big creatures and powerful combo plays to secure a victory in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures such as Valgavoth, Archon of Cruelty, and Griselbrand using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The goal is to win the game by efficiently bringing back powerful threats from the graveyard and overwhelming the opponent with their high impact abilities. The deck prioritizes a fast and consistent reanimation strategy while also being able to interact with the opponent's game plan through counterspells and disruptive creatures like Brazen Borrower.

This deck utilizes fast mana sources and tutors to quickly assemble a storm combo. Cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal help generate mana for explosive plays, while cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish allow for tutoring key combo pieces. Using cards like Tendrils of Agony and Ad Nauseam, the deck aims to generate a high storm count and win the game through a large, lethal Grapeshot effect. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Duress help protect the combo from opposing disruption, making it a powerful and resilient deck in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disrupt their game plan with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy. The deck focuses on using efficient creatures such as Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Goblin Bombardment for additional reach and versatility. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the "Show and Tell" combo to put big creatures into play, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also using powerful spells like Omniscience to gain a significant advantage over the opponent. The deck relies heavily on card manipulation with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Stock Up, as well as protection with Daze, Force of Will, and Veil of Summer. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and spell efficiency to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on using Show and Tell to quickly put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield for free. It also includes cards like Omniscience and Profane Tutor to set up game-winning combos. The deck uses cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo pieces. By utilizing Cunning Wish and Stock Up, the deck can search for specific answers or disrupt the opponent's strategy. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional utility and card advantage to help the combo succeed.

The main theme of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells in order to quickly deplete their life total. Utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Delver of Secrets, along with instant removal like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on while also disrupting their game plan with counter spells like Force of Will. The mana base is designed for efficiency and consistency, allowing the deck to consistently apply pressure and control the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures such as Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition to slow down opponents while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Kaldra Compleat. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play, while cards like Swords to Plowshares provide removal options. The deck also includes an equipment package with Meteor Sword and Pre-War Formalwear to enhance the creatures' attacks. The mana base is designed to disrupt opponents' lands with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter, while also providing utility with Karakas and Flagstones of Trokair.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently combo off and win the game using the powerful Doomsday card. The deck includes a variety of cantrips and disruption spells to set up the combo, along with cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly. Thassa's Oracle is the win condition, allowing the player to win the game on the spot if they have manipulated their library correctly with Doomsday. The deck focuses on speed and accuracy in executing the combo to secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells and removal spells, while also generating card advantage through cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck aims to lock down the opponent with cards like Back to Basics and Swords to Plowshares, while also utilizing powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Thundertrap Trainer to close out the game. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and card selection, while Snapcaster Mage allows for spell recursion. Overall, the deck focuses on control elements and tempo plays to outmaneuver the opponent.

Utilize a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to control the opponent's board and hand while gradually building card advantage and resources. Use efficient threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Thundertrap Trainer to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. Utilize Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage and advantage in card selection to stay ahead in the game. Leverage the versatile options provided by the Grixis color combination to adapt to different matchups and situations in order to outmaneuver and outlast opponents in a game of attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Eldrazi creatures while utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland to disrupt their game plan. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent, ultimately leading to a swift victory. The inclusion of cards like Reality Smasher and Devourer of Destiny further enhances the deck's ability to close out games efficiently. With a focus on Eldrazi synergy and disruption, this deck is designed to be a potent force in the Legacy format.

This deck focuses on assembling and executing a quick and powerful combo to win the game in a single turn. By utilizing cards like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual, the deck aims to quickly cast spells to mill the entire library and win with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. With a heavy emphasis on speed and efficiency, the deck can overwhelm opponents with its all-or-nothing approach to victory. The key strategy is to assemble the necessary pieces and execute the combo as quickly as possible before the opponent has a chance to stop it.

The deck is focused on quickly casting a large number of spells to either win the game immediately or set up a winning combo. It includes cards to accelerate mana production, protect key cards, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and quickly fill the graveyard with creatures for powerful reanimation spells. The goal is to quickly and efficiently combo off without giving the opponent a chance to react, utilizing key pieces like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty, Atraxa, and Griselbrand, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It uses cards like Unmask and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy while accelerating its own game plan with cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with high-powered creatures and win the game before they have a chance to respond.
